headline: Ooey-Gooey Cinnamon Buns
description: Cinnamon buns topped with a sweet and sticky pecan glaze. Enjoy these homemade cinnamon buns when they're gooey and warm, fresh from the oven!

video.description: These amazing sticky buns are topped with pecans and a luscious caramel sauce.
video.name: Ooey-Gooey Cinnamon Buns

name: Ooey-Gooey Cinnamon Buns
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

recipeInstructions.text: Make the dough: Pour water into a liquid measure. Add 1 teaspoon of sugar and active dry yeast; stir until dissolved. Let stand until foamy, about 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, warm milk in a small saucepan over medium heat until it just starts to bubble around the edges; do not boil. Remove from the heat and stir in 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup unsalted butter, and salt until melted. Let cool until lukewarm.
Lightly whisk eggs in a large bowl. Add yeast mixture, lukewarm milk mixture, and 1 1/2 cups flour; stir until well combined.
Mix in remaining 2 1/2 cups flour (1/2 cup at a time), mixing well after each addition, until dough comes together.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth, silky, and elastic, about 8 minutes.
Place dough in an oiled bowl and turn to coat with oil. Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.
While the dough is rising, make the glaze: Melt 3/4 cup of unsalted butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add 3/4 cup brown sugar and whisk until smooth.
Grease a 9x13-inch pan. Pour glaze mixture into the pan; sprinkle pecans over top.
Make the filling: Place 1/4 cup melted butter in a small bowl. Combine 3/4 cup of brown sugar, pecans, and cinnamon in a separate bowl.

When the dough has doubled in size, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. Roll into a 14x18-inch rectangle. Brush 1/2 of the melted butter over the dough, leaving a 1/2-inch border unbuttered. Sprinkle brown sugar mixture over top.
Start at the long edge and roll the dough tightly, pinching the seams to seal. Brush remaining butter over the dough. Cut dough into 15 equal rolls.
Place rolls, cut-sides down, into the glaze in the prepared pan. Cover and let rise until double in size, about 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Uncover and bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes.
Let cool in pan for 3 minutes, then invert onto a serving platter so the glaze is on top. Scrape any remaining glaze from the pan onto the rolls.

review.reviewBody: Excellent recipe and now a few tweaks: FOUR + Tablespoons of cinnamon! Fourth time making these and each time I’ve increased the amount of cinnamon and each time it’s better. Not only improved flavour, but the filling texture is improved. Raisins in the roll-up layer and walnuts instead of pecans round out my changes to equal a perfect ooey-gooey!
The only cinnamon bun recipe I use.

I used the dough recipe and then “ went it alone after that” with soft butter and an icing sugar/ milk frosting when warm. I had to add flour to make the dough the right consistency. Served to guests. Best cinnamon buns ever. The dough was perfect. Soft, buttery, and flakey. One lady ate 4!

I love these. I have made them many times but I cheat a little. I use my bread maker on dough setting, letting the yeast, water and sugar cream for 10 minutes then I add the rest of the liquids and all of the flour. Hit the dough button then carry on with the prep of filling and pans. After 90 minutes I roll out the dough and make the buns. Rise once more to double and bake and enjoy.
These turned out sooo good. They are a lot of work and take a long time but so worth it.

Love this recipe! It does take a while, but it is definitely worth it. It added icing on top of the cinnamon rolls though. Caramelize the pecan nuts for extra flavor. 100% recommend those cinnamon rolls are unreal
Amazing! So soft and delicious. Extremely sweet, so a once and a while treat. Thank you for this recipe!

I've made this recipe at least 6 times and it always turns out great. I use a deep pyrex pan for the second rising and baking. No problems with any spills over the edge. I also increased the second rising to 1 1/2 hours and place it in the oven with the proof setting. I find this makes the dough lighter and that much more yummy!
Very good recipe made it for the first time turned out perfect
Fantastic!!
Mine turned out as promised. I had the 5 grand children sample them and they gobbled them up. Nothing else needs to be said.
Perfect. Followed exact directions. Really delicious.

These are really good! I used margarine in place of some of the butter in the buns as I was short on butter - still used all butter in the glaze though. I didn't have enough brown sugar so I used white sugar and molasses for the rest. And I didn't have nuts so I cut up some apple and added it to the filling. (That was big win.)
The buns are so soft and tasty but the glaze made them stick so bad i will make them again but glaze rhem afterwards
I've tried a number of Cinnamon bun recipes. This is my favorite! Thank you.
The whole family loved it!! Will definitely make again.
Flavours are good but they’re just not good enough to be worth the work
Amazing but beware of the hot sugar icing when you take it out! My family ate it so quick even my dog stole one! Overall loved it
Great recipe! I loved that it was not too sweet. The toffee that formed on top off the buns was excellent.
This recipes has been a great hit, crowd pleasurer.

These tasted scrumptious, even tho mine were not ooey gooey. I can only imagine how they would be if they had the right consistency. For some reason the brown sugar and butter did not melt to make a nice caramel sauce; but remained gritty. Does anyone have any thoughts as to what I did wrong? I watched the video and followed the recipe exactly as written. Peace & Sparkles

Followed directions exactly. Very disappointed. Dough did not cook completely, even after 35 minutes. Sticky topping is still a bit gritty. I will not use this recipe again. Sad because wasted my entire morning and wasn't cheap. I usually refer to "allrecipes" for most of my recipes. Not this one!
They're good but not great. The caramel is a little gritty and the brown sugar inside didn't full melt. Followed the recipe exactly. A few mods would be necessary to make these 5 star.
This by far has to be one of the best desserts I’ve ever made! I took the first bite and was in love! 10/10 recommend!
Easy and fun to make.
absolutely wonderful, everyone loved them!

The dough is absolutely easy to handle and full of flavour. They rose perfectly. I did cut back a bit on last amount of brown sugar and butter, and they turned out just as delicious. Definitely a favourite
Fantastic recipe. Didn’t make any change and they turned out perfect. Soft and gooey just like the recipe promised. Thanks for sharing.

These turned out delicious although I didn’t have any milk so I used Funfetti flavored coffee creamer and reduced the sugar to 1/8 of a cup. I also heated an additional 3 Tbs of the creamer and drizzled over the top of the proofed rolls just before baking to increase the gooey factor!

Absolutely phenomenal! First time ever making homemade sticky buns, and these were relatively easy to make. I followed some other peoples advice and tweaked a thing or two here and there with amounts, but otherwise, perfect recipe!
I will definitely be making these again. My husband and 2 year old son are very satisfied!
Excellent, used half pecan and half sliced almonds.

Thanks to Kat1815's review, I placed a pan on the lower oven rack, to catch the drips, and it's a good thing I did! I doubled the caramel sauce as suggested by others, and divided the rolls prior to baking- they rose so much they needed more room! Furthermore, a few from my first batch also came out darker than I would have liked. I am reducing the bake time to 20 minutes for batch #2.

Finally found a cinnamon bun recipe that worked for me!! I read several reviews and followed these suggestion for perfect buns...read & reread the recipe; kneeded the dough at least 8 minutes; doubled the 'ooey-gooey' part, and placed the rolls in a deep dish. Absolutely perfect! Thank you so much.

These were SOOOO GOOD!! My kids and my husband were fighting over them. I did not change anything and made the recipe as is, I didn’t have pecans so I did not add them. They were fluffy and so delicious. I did flip them again at the end and brush whatever caramel was left on the pan after the first time that I flipped them so they could have caramel sauce on both sides, if that makes sense. I might double the amount of caramel sauce next time.
We always make these around Christmas and wrap them in foil and brown baker's paper, tie them with a bow and give them to the neighbors as treat!

I followed the recipe exactly and they were wonderful. Baked through, not soggy, nice crispy, flaky outside. Yummmmm! Easy directions to follow. I used a ceramic pan to bake in, I think they have the best results. I will make these again and again.
Second time. First time, pretty good outcome. This time, the dough was very dry coming out of the mixer, almost like I added too much flour, but followed the recipe to the letter. Any suggestions?
This is my go-to recipe for cinnamon buns. They are so delicious. I usually omit the pecans, but im sure they qould be good with as well.
Absolutely fantastic, I enjoyed them with cream cheese frosting. I've made this recipe a couple times and it turns out so good everytime. Just be prepared that this recipe takes a couple hours!

These cinnamon buns were fire!! It was my first time ever making the "inversion" method. it turned out beautifully!!! I did add a little icing on top and I used less pecans. But oh man, DO NOT OVERBAKE them. I did mine for 25min and they were perfectly browned. I did add a little vanilla extract to the dough lol.
So good! I have made these 3 times now and they always amaze with their light fluffy texture and delightful caramel topping!
Hands down best cinnamon buns ever! I add raisons and substitute walnuts, just for a change-up every now and again! Can't go wrong!

This is best recipe ever for cinnamon buns . I don't put any nuts in mine and I put a cream cheese frosting on them .And they are the best I have ever eating. As good as the one I have bought at store Even better.

Tasty but ......For the amount of work involved, I was disappointed. The dough is slow to rise and a lot of kneeling to get it the way it should be. The other reviews are correct more gooey is required. 
The only change I made was to put raisins in the actual cinnamon bun.
The actual baked cinnamon bun is kinda hard for my liking. 
I’ll stick to my own dough recipe.

The dough was really nice...beautiful in fact. It's the Ooey-Gooey that I'm not a fan of. It's enough to make you instantly diabetic. I'll make it again because of the dough, but I'm not including the addition of the goop you put into the pan before you put the rolls in. Even my son was put off by all that sugar.
It didn't caramelize as shown on the picture, perhaps that had something to do with it but I didn't want to overbake them.
Fairly easy!

Don’t shy away from this one, thinking it’s too difficult. It’s not and it’s totally worth it. I used this recipe for the very first time. I’d say I’m not the greatest or even a good baker and definitely not a patient baker.
Directions were easy to follow and the results were delicious!
it was a Hugh hit!!

I messed up....I didn’t let them rise properly; I should have watched the video bc I used my stand mixer...and that was a big mistake...when I could have used a spoon. I didn’t have cinnamon, and used pumpkin spice spice instead. But with all those errors; these were the best “cinnamon rolls” I have ever tasted!!! The hubby and kids loved them; and although they were starving by the time they ate them (hence why I didn’t let them rise properly); they said it was worth the wait. So if I made these faux pas and they were still this good, I can only imagine how amazing they will be when made properly?!!

First time making any kind of cinnamon roll from scratch. Didn't rise as much as I hoped, but I'm guessing that's because the kitchen was cold. For the 2nd rise, I put them in the oven with in on the warm setting for half the time, and it helped a lot. Didn't include nuts because I didn't have any, but I'm sure they'd be a great addition. Also didn't have a 2nd dish to invert them onto after baking, so I just poured the caramel on top of them instead of in the bottom of the dish so I could keep them in the same container. Turned out great! Will definitely try again, now that I have a better idea of what I'm doing.

I only added more cinnamon, because that's how I "roll". ;) 

Delicious recipe, and saved to my favs. 
Thanks for sharing!!

I tried the recipe and it was delicious, but I have an event coming up this weekend and I was curious if I could prepare the dough the night before and place it in the refrigerator to bake it the following day. Does anyone have any advice on this?
I liked the recipe very much but I would add more cinnamon next time. Lovely texture. I will make again. ??
the dough didnt even rise :( im so disappointed. i dont even know how to fix it

Well, not done baking quite yet but, the dough was the smoothest ever! Very easy to work with. I loved the brown sugar, cinnamon and Pecans as the filling. I've always used white sugar, no Pecans. Needless to say, I can not wait for these guys to come out of the oven! I'll keep you posted....
Very delicious recipe! The more they rise, the fluffier.

Followed the recipe exactly, they turned out beautiful and are a big hit with the family! Seems like a lot of directions but it all flows nicely and is well worth the effort. I’ve never made any dough from scratch that turned out as well as this one. Definitely will make again! Maybe even tomorrow!

made these buns last week, very good!, excellent reciepe to follow,too.
i put the buns on parchment.
Ps they didnt last the day!

I made this with a few alterations. I used sweet glazed pecans and saves some out. I took about 1/3 cup of pecans and crushed them with a rolling pin and put into the cinnamon layer so it was rolled in. I also used a different caramel recipe where I had some heavy cream added into the caramel and cooked it until thick (about 8 minutes). Just small tweaks. Don’t be afraid to change things just a little bit when baking. Make it your own.

I have made sticky buns every Christmas every year., for more than 30 years. This is the best recipe that I have found. My recipe is almost exactly the same as this one except I have always used shortening instead of butter. Due to a family lactose issue I had to eliminate dairy, substituting margarine for butter and yogurt for milk. We prefer raisins to nuts but both are delicious. The the Ooey-Gooey Cinnamon Buns turned out perfect. This will be my go to recipe.

EXCELLENT. I made these for Christmas morning (woke up at 5 to get it started) and the family reviews were glowing (not me, the recipe). My mom had a long ago, lost recipe and she said hands down, this was better. Many thanks to the original poster.

I make it the night before and store in the fridge overnight. In the morning I pull it out and leave on the counter for 1 hour. I change the oven temp to 350 and cook for only 25 minutes. Perfect results! Excellent recipe!
Thank you! I, too, now make the best cinnamon buns ever with this recipe!!

I have been to heaven, and they sent me back with these Ooey-Gooey Cinnamon Buns. Absolutely delicious and I couldn't have just one. Semi-homemade tip, use frozen bread dough (I used Rhode's) if you need a shortcut!

These turned out perfect. Came out exactly like the picture. The only thing I did differently was toast the pecans in my toaster oven. After I toasted them, I let them cool and then crumbled them with my hands before putting them into the brown sugar/butter sauce. It added a nice crispiness that made the pecans stand out in a good way.
Exactly right! The perfect amount of soft dough and delicious sugary gooeyness that cinnamon buns should have. Best recipe I’ve found so far!!
They were so good! My husband loved them! He loves nuts, there were so many. Thank you for sharing this recipe!! I will make it again!
Super delicious recipe! Pay attention to the 2.5hr prep time, as your family will get impatient waiting. Only thing i added was vanilla to the butter mixture that was spread on the dough.

This recipe was superb! I’ve been searching for a cinnamon bun recipe that would be soft and gooey, and this is it! The buns are delicate and nicely caramelized. Based on reviews, I altered the recipe a bit before making.
1) I made the dough and put it in the fridge, covered overnight to save time. In the morning, I took the dough out 30 minutes before I wanted to use it.
2) I doubled the amount of caramel sauce in the pan.
3) Instead of putting melted butter on the dough, I combined the softened butter with brown sugar and cinnamon for the filling.
4) I only baked for 20 minutes in a metal 9x13. They were definitely done!

I love this recipe so does my family. I make them for breakfast for us and my nieghbors and I add chocolate chips on my sugar and cinnamon then roll it up and its ooey and gooey and tasty. Best breakfast ever when you wanting to treat yourself. I make scrambled eggs and fruit salad on the side and make them a little smaller then what the recipe says.
Made exactly as written. I bake a ton of stuff but these burnt after only 20 mins in the oven. My oven doesn't run hot so not sure what happened. Will make again but bake at 350.
This recipe is amazing. I personally add a bit more cinnamon, but nevertheless I have made these cinnamon buns countless times now. My Grandparents love them.
So good. Will definitely make again.
Wow. These are so good. I followed instructions to the letter and are worth the time and effort. Help I can’t stop eating them.
I have made these many timesand you don't have to change a thing....they are excellent!!!!!!
Made them exactly as described, and they are DELICIOUS!
I have made them so many times. I did not change anything. Everyone loves them. They were delicious.
Perfection! Followed the recipe almost exactly - added 2 extra tbsp butter and sugar to the caramel mixture and turned the oven down to 350 halfway through as mine were browning quickly on the tops.
I made no chgs... my bread wasn’t as cloud-stretchy after baking. I’ll try again and use pastry flour.
The recipe for the dough and filling is bang on. The extra butter and nut to put in the pan just increase the calories. I made them without that and they are awesome.
Awesome! Will definitely make these again. I followed the recipe as written.
Fantastic
I only did the filling, and I added a cream cheese, butter and powdered sugar glaze on top. Otherwise too sugary for me.

Ok as a 1st time baker I followed the instructions along with the video and they came out horrible to be but the family loved them.... My pecan glaze came out hard like candy so I scrapped it off made some icing from another recipe I got on and iced them up. I’ll probably try again being that it was my first time ever making cinnamon rolls from scratch.
I over baked - just to be sure they were done. The sugar caramelized and so it was tough to chew- don't over bake

I did not find these cinnamon rolls to be "gooey". If I make them again, I will add much more butter, cinnamon, and brown sugar, especially in the lower layer which is the top layer when inverted. The dough is very good and rose very well. In fact, I would use a pan larger than a 9X13 because the rolls had to be stuffed into the pan and rose so much that the centers popped up above the outer layers. Overall, a good cinnamon roll but not sweet enough for me.
So delicious!!
Sinfully delicious!
Excellent instructions and they were delicious.
Great recipe.I make them every year as Christmas gifts! People love them!
Very Good - Everyone Loved
These were delicious! They soft and moist and perfect. I added some chocolate chips and icing on top. Will definitely make these again.
I just made this recipe I adjusted it for 24 and I only have 12 left! I LOVE IT!!!!!!!!! Just like that place in the mall everyone loves!!
Amazing!!!! Easy to follow turned out incredible. Will definately make these again
Worth the 3 hours of work! Great recipe

These sticky buns are amazing! They are the perfect level of moist and sweet. I read the reviews about the pan overflowing, so I used a glass baking dish and it was fine. I will be making these often.

I love this recipe! However my dough comes out a little different every time. It could be the temperature of the water I use to activate the yeast? I haven't completely nailed it yet. But when they come out of the oven, perfection!!!!

This recipe was nice, but it isn't as sweet as you would think. If you decide to make this recipe half sweet, prepare for some"healthy" cinnamon buns. if you want to replicate those store bought cinnamon buns, add a bit more sugar
